title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.1 PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION O

description.narrative: Output 6.1 (Social protection)Government has improved capacity to implement effective child-focused, shock-responsive programmes to protect all children from social, climate and environmental risks, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and adolescents, especially the poorest and most vulnerable children, benefit from evidence based planning and public expenditure, reliable data and an expanded universal social protection system that accounts for environmental risks and disasters.

Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.1 (Social protection)Government has improved capacity to implement effective child-focused, shock-responsive programmesto protect all children from social, climate and environmental risks

description.narrative: UNICEF in partnership with the Government of Indonesia, UN agencies and local think-tanks successfully engaged in evidence-based advocacy by developing analytical reports on the socio-economic impacts of COVID-19 on households with particular attention to poor and vulnerable children, woman-headed households, and people with disabilities that informed policy and programme decisions on COVID-19 response.; The Dynamic Microsimulation for COVID-19 impact on Child Poverty in Indonesia; influenced governmental decision on investing in social protection. UNICEF also took a leadership role in the joint SDG project to develop a framework of adaptive social protection to mitigate socioeconomic and climate risks and shocks.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/12/2021

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF intervened sub-national adopting policies on child-focused social protection programmes (cumulative), Text

baseline.value: 4 districts out of (total number of district in 8 Provinces of UNICEF focus area)

target.value: 2025:53 out of (total number of district in 8 Provinces of UNICEF focus area)

actual.value: 2021:Only Aceh Jaya District has discussed with UNICEF to enact the programme
